item.title: Orphaned case?
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

strucker:

oprhaned case means that you have two cases 9158.

Read the error, it means that the case is orphaned, and therefore belongs to no switch.

It’s outside of a switch, and is orphaned.

The reason it said that was because it was inside of an if statement, which was inside of the switch (and therefore outside of the switch).

To support that, I can assure you that there is only one case 9158 present in that file.

EDIT: BTW, I don’t think you need that very last bracket anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Orphaned case?

Read full topic

item.title: Orphaned case?
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

ClairtyX:

Here are my Clickingbuttons.java see if you can find the problem http://pastebin.com/TLa7YwzQ

if (c.dialogueAction == 1327) { c.getItems().deleteAllItems(); Dungeoneering.redostartfloor1(c);

Missing bracket inside of a switch statement, and therefore the cases within it are orphaned (not within a switch).

Do this and you should be good to go:

if (c.dialogueAction == 1327) { c.getItems().deleteAllItems(); Dungeoneering.redostartfloor1(c); }

Before that, it thought everything between line 580 and 1651 was part of that if() statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Orphaned case?
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

ClairtyX:

What do you mean quote it out?

Sorry, “comment” it out.

EDIT: As in /* in front of “case 9158:” and */ after “break;”

/* case 9158: if (c.dialogueAction == 8) { c.getPA().fixAllBarrows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); } break; */

EDIT2: I’m on my PC now, so I can help more (I have my PI server here)

Hit Ctrl + F and make sure it’s searching upwards, not down, and then type in “switch”

The first thing you find, make sure it closes off after the last case related to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Orphaned case?
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

[quote=“ClairtyX, post:1, topic:467781”]I got this error and I have no idea what’s wrong. It’s PI base.

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:651: error: orphaned case case 9158: ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

This is the code.

[code=java]case 9158:
if (c.dialogueAction == 8) {
c.getPA().fixAllBarrows();
} else {
c.dialogueAction = 0;
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
}
break;

		/**Specials**/
		case 29188:
		c.specBarId = 7636; // the special attack text - sendframe126(S P E C I A L  A T T A C K, c.specBarId);
		c.usingSpecial = !c.usingSpecial;
		c.getItems().updateSpecialBar();
		break;[/code]

The stuff under it I think may be the problem.[/quote]

Quote it out and tell me what it returns.

EDIT: If the issue is what I think it is, it should return the same error on the next one.

Read full topic

item.title: Orphaned case?
item.dc:creator: @ClairtyX ClairtyX
item.description:
@ClairtyX wrote:

I got this error and I have no idea what’s wrong. It’s PI base.

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:651: error: orphaned case case 9158: ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

This is the code.

[code=java]case 9158:
if (c.dialogueAction == 8) {
c.getPA().fixAllBarrows();
} else {
c.dialogueAction = 0;
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
}
break;

		/**Specials**/
		case 29188:
		c.specBarId = 7636; // the special attack text - sendframe126(S P E C I A L  A T T A C K, c.specBarId);
		c.usingSpecial = !c.usingSpecial;
		c.getItems().updateSpecialBar();
		break;[/code]

The stuff under it I think may be the problem.
